column4: anyone having issues with karmic and nvidia graphics cards having low res?
airtronix :> what cards are you using?
Rick > I am finding that out. Laptop fires off no issue. Desktop , with 2 8800 gts, no go
Airtronix, running 2 8800gt on my desktop , and will only do 640x480
airtronix > 3 monitors
Airtronix > Only time I can get 1680x1050 is without nvidia drivers, and even then only 1 monitor
trying now
is that with the drivers supplied by ubuntu or the latest/greatest from nvidia?
make sure if you install that, that you uninstall the nvidia bits supplied by ubuntu
no reboot necessary .. when you install the nvidia drivers you have to be at cli with gdm shutdown.. install then "sudo service gdm start" to bring graphics back up
I had done that before I just tried with a reboot still no go
I missed most of the previous conversation.. what are you trying to accomplish?
, getting more then 640x480 out of my 8800gt graphics cards under karmic
lcd monitor or crt?

by 3?  three monitors? ok.. start with one leaving the others unplugged.. get that going first.. then add the next.. remember that there are really 2 different resolutions you're working with .. the size of X and the rez of each monitor.. X needs to be the size of the 3 put together.. xrandr handles a lot of that.. also nvidia-settings
don't do it while the computer is booted..
do you also have 2 video cards?

that can also be an issue.. in the past, and still.. if you install with more than one monitor plugged in and more than one card things get goofy.. I think you're experiencing the "goofy" part of it.. you'll need to hand write a xorg most likely.. but if you don't have anything important on the machine.. get rid of one card and all but one monitor and reinstall.. then add one thing at a time..
my feeling exactly... however if you want some reading.. check out.http://superuser.com/questions/65989/ubuntu-9-10-3-monitors-setup
, in the middle of reinstall gotta love it
